channel.title: Server Help please
channel.description:
Hi, I made a RS Server before and never had this problem before. when i run the server appl it says server started as you will see but no ip or host please help [IMG]http://i425.photobucket.com/albums/pp331/Gareth_911/see.jpg[/img]
And This doesnt seem to be like last time can some 1 tell me if this is the correct stuff please: [IMG]http://i425.photobucket.com/albums/pp331/Gareth_911/see1.jpg[/img]
ANY HELP Will be good please.. thanks
any 1 please help...[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 18, 2008, 11:09:04 pm[/size][hr]Can some 1 please help.. me ...

item.title: Server Help please
item.dc:creator: @cutless cutless
item.description:
@cutless wrote:

Also when I run mine it dosent say my ip and port it only says Remote Scape Online, and it runs find, but just make sure you changed the ip to yours in client.java and change “127.0.0.1” to your ip…

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help please
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

You either make your own No-IP,
or use 127.0.0.1 or ‘Localhost’ they are a computers default
Network connections, only you can use them.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Help please
item.dc:creator: @Rich911 Rich911
item.description:

		clientListener = new java.net.ServerSocket(serverlistenerPort, 1, null);

			java.net.Socket s = acceptSocketSafe(clientListener);
			s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
			String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();
			if(/*connectingHost.startsWith("localhost") || connectingHost.equals("127.0.0.1")*/true) {
				if (connectingHost.startsWith("computing") || connectingHost.startsWith("server2")) {
					misc.println(connectingHost+": Checking if server still is online...");
				} else {
					int Found = -1;
					for (int i = 0; i < MaxConnections; i++) {
						if (Connections[i] == connectingHost) {
							Found = ConnectionCount[i];
							break;
						}
					}
					if (Found < 3)

if(!SYIBlocker.bannedIP(connectingHost))

item.title: Server Help please
item.dc:creator: @bonzakid bonzakid
item.description:
@bonzakid wrote:

Set your environmental variables.
“It doesnt tell me what ip or port” It is not supposed to.
You could just go to server.java and look at the port obviously?
Someone who coded the server you had before must of been a dropkick because he must of been 2years old…

Read full topic

@LilJR1 wrote:

ahh i help u in this ok so ur saying u dont got a ip cause u saying what the ip this is what u do ook go on no-ip.com register then add a host then make it ur ip and then ur sone with that part then… u got to download utorrent go on google and type download utorrent or something then to make it to ur port which the best so far is 43594 to do that after u install utorrent go to preference then go to connection and type in 43594 in ur port this then click ok now click run on server again then there u got ur server on!!!
